pullRequest.body:
Define the derived set of a set, and prove some properties. Also prove `AccPt.map`.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AccPt.map`
`+ Continuous.image_derivedSet`
`+ IsPreconnected.inter_derivedSet_nonempty`
`+ IsPreconnected.preperfect_of_nontrivial`
`+ derivedSet`
`+ derivedSet_closure`
`+ derivedSet_mono`
`+ derivedSet_subset_closure`
`+ derivedSet_union`
`+ isClosed_derivedSet`
`+ isClosed_iff_derivedSet_subset`
`+ mem_derivedSet`
`+ perfect_iff_eq_derivedSet`
`+ preperfect_iff_subset_derivedSet`

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14787~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Can you please merge master?
I see the changes of #14787 were duplicated, what caused this?
They're not duplicated, but the diff in this PR was against a version of Master prior to when your other PR was merged.

bors d+

please complete the last change above, then wait for CI to finish before merging.

:v: Command-Master can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10121289779/job/27992042601)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10121289779/job/27992042527)
Is there a better spelling for a set being dense-in-itself?
There's Preperfect, I changed it to use it.

I wonder if there's any reason *not* to allow for arbitrary filters as inputs. I guess it means you can't iterate the `derivedSet` as easily, and maybe some theorems aren't as pretty. This is just food for thought.
The theorems would be less pretty, and if you're using an arbitrary filter you could just directly use `AccPt` — how often do you want it as a set?

unlocks dot notation
```suggestion
theorem Continuous.image_derivedSet {β : Type*} [TopologicalSpace β] {A : Set X} {f : X → β}
```
We don't like to have non-terminal `simp`s like this, because it makes debugging breakage hard. Can you squeeze this `simp` with `simp?` and replace it with the result of the `Try this:`?

With this lemma:
```lean
lemma derivedSet_subset_closure (A : Set X) : derivedSet A ⊆ closure A :=
  fun _ hx ↦ mem_closure_iff_clusterPt.mpr hx.clusterPt
```
you can golf the `mp` direction to:
```suggestion
lemma isClosed_iff_derivedSet_subset (A : Set X) : IsClosed A ↔ derivedSet A ⊆ A where
  mp h := derivedSet_subset_closure A |>.trans h.closure_subset
```

You can prove (with `import Mathlib.Tactic.Peel`):
```lean
/-- In a `T1Space`, the `derivedSet` of the closure of a set is equal to the derived set of the
set itself.

Note: this doesn't hold in a space with the indiscrete topology. For example, if `X` is a type with
two elements, `x` and `y`, and `A := {x}`, then `closure A = Set.univ` and `derivedSet A = {y}`,
but `derivedSet Set.univ = Set.univ`. -/
lemma derivedSet_closure [T1Space X] (A : Set X) : derivedSet (closure A) = derivedSet A := by
  refine le_antisymm (fun x hx => ?_) (derivedSet_mono _ _ subset_closure)
  rw [mem_derivedSet, AccPt, (nhdsWithin_basis_open x {x}ᶜ).inf_principal_neBot_iff] at hx ⊢
  peel hx with u hu _
  obtain ⟨-, hu_open⟩ := hu
  exact mem_closure_iff.mp this.some_mem.2 (u ∩ {x}ᶜ) (hu_open.inter isOpen_compl_singleton)
    this.some_mem.1
```
at which point you can reduce the proof to:
```suggestion
  rw [← derivedSet_closure, isClosed_iff_derivedSet_subset]
  apply derivedSet_mono
  simp [← isClosed_iff_derivedSet_subset]
```
the style is very strange here. I'm having trouble even making out what's going on. Can you improve it?
Is this better?

```suggestion
  · apply Set.Nonempty.right at h
    rw [Set.singleton_inter_nonempty, mem_closure_iff_clusterPt, ← acc_principal_iff_cluster] at h
    exact h
```
